conclusion: A particle with charge +q and mass m enters at point O; There are two magnetic fields: B₁ above the MN line and B₂ below; B₁ = 2B₂; The particle initially moves perpendicular to MN, entering B₁ region first; We need to find the time until it returns to point O moving downward

When a charged particle enters a uniform magnetic field, it experiences a force: F = qv × B (Lorentz force); This force is always perpendicular to both velocity and magnetic field; The particle follows a circular path with radius r = mv/(qB)
In the B₁ region, the particle will move in a semicircular path with radius r₁ = mv/(qB₁)
The time to complete a semicircle in B₁ region is t₁ = πr₁/v = πm/(qB₁)
After completing the semicircle in B₁ region, the particle returns to the MN line (point O), now moving downward
In the B₂ region, the particle moves in a circular path with radius r₂ = mv/(qB₂) = 2r₁
The time to complete a semicircle in B₂ region is t₂ = 2πm/(qB₁)
The total time for the particle to return to point O moving downward is T = t₁ + t₂ = 3πm/(qB₁)
The time it takes for the particle to return to point O moving downward is 3πm/(qB₁)
